bibl.title: George Hawkins v. The United States of America. Writ of Habeas corpus and Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.ab:
United States of America.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, Ninth Judicial Circuit~~~District of Washington. Northern DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF George Hawkins ON HABEAS CORPUS.
The President of the United States of America, To the Warden of the U.S. Penitentiary McNeils Island Washinton
div1.p:
Greeting:
You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of George Hawkins by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washingotn, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of Seattle on the 7th day of Nov 1902 189 at 2 o'clock P.M., to do and receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 5th day of Nov. in the year of our Lord one thousand nine eight hundred and ninety two and of our Independence the 127th

In obedience to the within Writ, I hereby produce the body of Geo. Hawkins as within directed and return that I hold him in my custody, by virtue of a Commitment issued Mch 22nd 1901- by Arthur H. Noyes Judge- of U.S. Dist. Court for District of Alaska - 2nd- Division-
div1.ab: C. B. Hopkins U.S. Marshal and Ex office warden of U.S. Penitentiary on McNeils Island
Marshals Expense To McNiel's and With Prisoner 4.10
Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGOTN, Northern Division.

IN THE MATTER OF Geo. Hawkins
ON HABEAS CORPUS.
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
Filed on return, this 7 day of Nov 1902 189
By A. N. Moore. Deputy Clerk.
